questions.question: I saw her ……………………….. the plants.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after see.

questions.question: I told him ……………………….
questions.description: Tell is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: She didn’t let me ……………………….. her room.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I was made …………………………. for hours.
questions.description: When make is used in the passive form, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: They made me ……………………….. the papers.
questions.description: Make is followed by an infinitive

questions.question: I was forced ………………………….
questions.description: Forced is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I heard her …………………………… something.
questions.description: Hear is followed by an infinitive

questions.question: He dared not ………………………… the door.
questions.description: When dare is a modal, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You need not ………………………… any further.
questions.description: When need is a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: Do you dare ………………………… me names?
questions.description: When dare is an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You ought …………………………. your ways.
questions.description: Ought is followed by an infinitive with to.
